page.title: 17HOLBROOK CENTRE
page.content: PHASE ONE OF HOLBROOK CENTRE WAS BUILT IN 1976 AT A COST OF Â£25,000. APPROXIMATELY 5,000 PEOPLE USE HOLBROOK RECREATION CENTRE EACH WEEK. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SWIMMING, SQUASH, AEROBICS, FOOTBALL, CRICKET, BILLIARDS, TABLE TENNIS, YOGA AND WEIGHT TRAINING. CLUBS INCLUDE A SHAPE SHOP, FUN CLUB, KUNG FU AND POP MOBILITY CLASS. THE MOST POPULAR ACTIVITY IS SWIMMING. THE POOL IS ONE OF THE FIRST IN THIS COUNTRY TO HAVE AN OZONE WATER TREATMENT PLANT. AS WELL AS THE MAIN POOL OF 600,000 GALLONS THERE IS A LEARNER POOL. ONE OF THE MANY FACILITIES IS A SWIMMING GROUP FOR MOTHERS AND BABIES. THE CENTRE HAS A SUN BED, SAUNA AND SOLARIUM, AS WELL AS A POOL-SIDE REFRESHMENT BAR.
